literature.book: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
literature.author: J.K. Rowling
literature.key_passage: There were a hundred and forty-two staircases at Hogwarts: wide, sweeping ones; narrow, rickety ones; some that led somewhere different on a Friday; some with a vanishing step halfway up that you had to remember to jump...

vanishing_step.literary: Step that disappears and you must jump over
vanishing_step.pattern: Fail-fast with knowledge retention (remember to jump)

polite_doors.literary: Doors that only open if asked politely

friday_redirect.literary: Some stairs lead somewhere different on a Friday

everything_moves.literary: It all seemed to move around a lot

insights.observation: Fiction predicted distributed systems patterns decades before they emerged
Memory as security: knowing where vanishing steps are protects you
insights.example: Error memory prevents repeated failures (learning circuit breaker)

insights.observation: Politeness as authentication: human interaction patterns in systems
insights.example: Include 'please' in request headers for graceful degradation
Friday redirects = A/B testing on schedule

safety_notes: Vanishing steps (traps) are known and documented
Route cache clears on ANY movement (conservative)
Locked routes require explicit authentication context
